storyTitle: As Approver, I want to review and approve schedule change requests to ensure proper schedule management

testCases.title: Approve a schedule change request successfully
preconditions: Approver account exists with valid credentials
Approver has appropriate approval permissions assigned
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Schedule change request is assigned to the logged-in approver
System is accessible and operational

steps.action: Navigate to the application login page and enter valid approver credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard/home page

steps.action: Navigate to the pending approvals section/dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: List of pending schedule change requests assigned to the approver is displayed with request details (requester name, date, type, submission date)

steps.action: Select a specific pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing complete information including requester details, requested changes, reason, and any attachments

steps.action: Click the 'Approve' button and optionally enter a comment in the comment field, then click 'Submit' or 'Confirm'
steps.expectedResult: Request status updates to 'Approved' within 1 second, success message is displayed, and the request is removed from pending list or marked as approved

steps.action: Verify that the requester receives notification of approval by checking the notification system or requester's notification inbox
steps.expectedResult: Notification is successfully sent to the requester containing approval status, approver name, timestamp, and any comments provided

steps.action: Navigate to approval history or audit log section
steps.expectedResult: Approval action is logged with timestamp, approver details, request ID, action taken (approved), and comments

postconditions: Schedule change request status is 'Approved' in the database
Requester has received approval notification via configured channels
Approval action is recorded in audit trail with complete details
Request is no longer in pending approvals list
Approver remains logged in to the system

testCases.title: Reject a schedule change request with mandatory comment
preconditions: Approver account exists with valid credentials and approval permissions
Approver is logged into the system
At least one pending schedule change request exists assigned to the approver
System validation rules for mandatory rejection comments are configured

steps.action: From the pending approvals dashboard, select a schedule change request that needs to be rejected by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page is displayed with complete information about the schedule change request

steps.action: Click the 'Reject' button
steps.expectedResult: Rejection form is displayed with a mandatory comment input field clearly marked as required, and Submit/Cancel buttons

steps.action: Leave the comment field empty and click the 'Submit' or 'Confirm Rejection' button
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating 'Comment is required for rejection' or similar message, and rejection is not processed

steps.action: Enter a valid rejection comment in the comment field (e.g., 'Request conflicts with operational requirements') and click 'Submit' or 'Confirm Rejection'
steps.expectedResult: Request status updates to 'Rejected' within 1 second, success message is displayed, and request is removed from pending list or marked as rejected

steps.action: Verify that notification is sent to the requester by checking notification logs or requester's notification inbox
steps.expectedResult: Rejection notification is sent to the requester containing rejection status, approver name, timestamp, and the mandatory rejection comment

steps.action: Navigate to approval history or audit log section and locate the rejected request
steps.expectedResult: Rejection action is logged with timestamp, approver details, request ID, action taken (rejected), and the rejection comment

postconditions: Schedule change request status is 'Rejected' in the database
Rejection comment is stored with the request
Requester has received rejection notification with comments
Rejection action is recorded in audit trail
Request is no longer in pending approvals list

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized approval actions
preconditions: Two user accounts exist: one unauthorized user without approval permissions and one authorized approver
At least one pending schedule change request exists in the system
Authorization and authentication mechanisms are properly configured
API endpoint security is enabled

steps.action: Log in to the system using unauthorized user credentials (user without approval permissions)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the pending approvals dashboard or directly access a schedule change request approval page via URL manipulation
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with error message 'You do not have permission to access this resource' or similar, and user is redirected to appropriate page or shown 403 Forbidden error

steps.action: Attempt to call the approval API endpoint directly (PUT /api/schedule-change-requests/{id}/approval) using unauthorized user credentials
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden or 401 Unauthorized status code with appropriate error message, and no changes are made to the request status

steps.action: Log out the unauthorized user and log in using authorized approver credentials
steps.expectedResult: Authorized approver is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Pending approvals dashboard is accessible and displays list of pending schedule change requests

steps.action: Select a pending request and click 'Approve' button, optionally add a comment, and submit the approval
steps.expectedResult: Approval is processed successfully, request status updates to 'Approved' within 1 second, and success message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the approval action in the audit log
steps.expectedResult: Approval action is logged with authorized approver's details, timestamp, and action taken

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are blocked and logged in security audit trail
Schedule change request status is 'Approved' only after authorized approver action
System security integrity is maintained
Authorized approver remains logged in

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications about schedule change request status to stay informed

testCases.title: Verify notification sent on schedule change request submission
preconditions: Employee account exists with valid credentials
Employee has valid email address configured in the system
Employee is logged into the system
Notification service is operational and configured
Email server is accessible and functional
In-app notification system is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request submission page from the employee dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request form is displayed with all required fields (date, time, reason, etc.)

steps.action: Fill in all required fields with valid data (select date, time, enter reason for change) and click 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Request is successfully submitted, confirmation message is displayed, and request is saved in the system with 'Pending' status

steps.action: Check the employee's email inbox for submission confirmation notification within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received containing submission confirmation, request ID, submitted date/time, requested changes, and current status (Pending)

steps.action: Navigate to the in-app notifications section or notification bell icon in the application
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed showing submission confirmation with request details including request ID, submission timestamp, and status

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification to view details
steps.expectedResult: Notification expands or navigates to show complete details of the submitted request matching the information in the email notification

steps.action: Navigate to notification history or logs section in the admin panel or system logs
steps.expectedResult: Notification record is logged with timestamp, recipient (employee), notification type (submission confirmation), delivery status (sent), and channels used (email and in-app)

postconditions: Employee has received submission confirmation via both email and in-app channels
Notification is logged in the system with timestamp and delivery status
Schedule change request remains in 'Pending' status
Employee can view notification history
Notification was delivered within 1 minute of submission

testCases.title: Verify notification sent on approval decision
preconditions: Employee has submitted a schedule change request that is in 'Pending' status
Approver account exists with approval permissions
Employee has valid email address and in-app notification access
Notification service is operational
Request is assigned to an active approver

steps.action: Log in as an approver with valid credentials
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to pending approvals dashboard and select the employee's schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Request details are displayed with all relevant information

steps.action: Click 'Approve' button, optionally enter approval comments (e.g., 'Approved as requested'), and submit the approval
steps.expectedResult: Request status updates to 'Approved', success message is displayed, and approval is processed

steps.action: Log out as approver and log in as the employee who submitted the request
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Check the employee's email inbox for approval notification within 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received containing approval status, approver name, approval timestamp, request details, and any comments provided by the approver

steps.action: Navigate to in-app notifications section in the employee dashboard
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed showing approval status with complete details including approver name, timestamp, and comments

steps.action: Click on the notification to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Notification details page opens displaying approval status, approver comments, approval date/time, and updated request status with all relevant information

steps.action: Verify notification logging in the system logs or notification history
steps.expectedResult: Approval notification is logged with timestamp, recipient (employee), notification type (approval), delivery channels (email and in-app), and delivery status (sent)

postconditions: Employee has received approval notification via email and in-app channels
Notification includes approval status and approver comments
Notification is logged with complete details and timestamp
Schedule change request status is 'Approved'
Employee is informed of the approval decision

testCases.title: Ensure notifications are not sent to unauthorized users
preconditions: Multiple user accounts exist in the system
A schedule change request exists submitted by Employee A
Employee B exists but is not associated with the request
Notification service is operational with security controls enabled
System has authorization checks configured for notification delivery

steps.action: Identify a schedule change request submitted by Employee A and note the request ID
steps.expectedResult: Request details are visible showing Employee A as the requester

steps.action: Attempt to trigger a notification for this request to Employee B (unauthorized user) either through API call, system manipulation, or notification service directly using POST /api/notifications endpoint
steps.expectedResult: System validates the recipient against the request and blocks the notification attempt with error message 'Unauthorized recipient' or similar

steps.action: Check Employee B's email inbox and in-app notifications
steps.expectedResult: No notification related to Employee A's schedule change request is received by Employee B

steps.action: Review notification logs or security audit logs for the blocked notification attempt
steps.expectedResult: Blocked notification attempt is logged with timestamp, attempted recipient (Employee B), request ID, reason for blocking (unauthorized user), and security event details

steps.action: Trigger a legitimate notification for the same request to Employee A (the actual requester) by having an approver approve or reject the request
steps.expectedResult: Notification is successfully sent to Employee A via email and in-app channels

steps.action: Verify Employee A receives the notification while Employee B does not
steps.expectedResult: Employee A has the notification in email and in-app, Employee B has no notifications related to this request

steps.action: Check notification logs to confirm proper delivery
steps.expectedResult: Notification log shows successful delivery to Employee A only, with no delivery attempts to Employee B for legitimate notifications

postconditions: Unauthorized user (Employee B) did not receive any notifications for requests they are not associated with
Blocked notification attempt is logged in security audit trail
Authorized user (Employee A) received notifications successfully
System security controls for notification delivery are validated
Notification service maintains authorization integrity

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to view reports on schedule change approvals to monitor workflow efficiency

testCases.title: View schedule change approval dashboard with filters
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
Schedule change approval data exists in the system
User has network connectivity
Browser is supported (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
Manager has authorization to access reporting portal

steps.action: Manager navigates to the reporting portal by clicking on 'Reports' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Reporting portal page loads successfully

steps.action: Manager selects 'Schedule Change Approval Reports' from the available report types
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard with metrics and charts is displayed showing approval times, pending requests, volumes, and outcomes with visual representations

steps.action: Manager clicks on the date range filter and selects a custom date range (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Manager selects a specific department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department filter is applied and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Manager clicks 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard updates to reflect filtered data showing only schedule change approvals for the selected date range and department. Charts and tables refresh with filtered metrics

steps.action: Manager clicks on 'Export' button and selects 'CSV' format from the export options
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is downloaded to the default download location with correct filtered data including all visible metrics, properly formatted columns, and accurate values matching the dashboard display

postconditions: Dashboard remains in filtered state
CSV file is saved locally on manager's device
Export action is logged in system audit trail
User session remains active

testCases.title: Verify dashboard load time under normal load
preconditions: User is logged in with Manager role credentials
System is under normal load conditions (peak hours)
Network connection is stable with normal bandwidth
Schedule change approval data exists in the system
Performance monitoring tools are available to measure load time

steps.action: Manager navigates to the reporting portal during peak business hours (e.g., 9 AM - 11 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Reporting portal navigation is initiated

steps.action: Manager selects 'Schedule Change Approval Reports' and starts timer to measure load time
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard loads completely with all metrics, charts, and tables displayed within 3 seconds. All visual elements are rendered properly and data is fully populated

steps.action: Verify all dashboard components are interactive and responsive
steps.expectedResult: All filters, buttons, charts, and tables are functional and respond to user interactions without delay

postconditions: Dashboard is fully loaded and functional
Performance metrics are recorded
User session remains active
System maintains normal load performance

testCases.title: Ensure unauthorized users cannot access reports
preconditions: User is logged in with non-manager role (e.g., Employee, Contractor)
Role-based access control is configured in the system
User does not have managerial permissions
Reporting portal exists and is accessible to authorized users

steps.action: Non-manager user attempts to navigate to the reporting dashboard by entering the URL directly or clicking on Reports menu (if visible)
steps.expectedResult: Access denied message is displayed with text similar to 'You do not have permission to access this resource' or 'Access Restricted to Managers Only'

steps.action: Verify that no report data or dashboard elements are visible to the unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: No sensitive data, metrics, charts, or tables are displayed. User remains on access denied page or is redirected to their authorized home page

steps.action: Check system logs for the unauthorized access attempt
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized access attempt is logged in security audit trail with timestamp, user ID, and attempted resource

postconditions: User remains logged in with their original role
No unauthorized access to reporting data occurred
Security event is logged
User is redirected to appropriate authorized page

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to escalate pending schedule change approvals to ensure timely decisions

testCases.title: Automatic escalation of overdue approvals
preconditions: Escalation rules and thresholds are configured in the system (e.g., 48 hours)
Schedule change request exists and is pending approval
Higher-level approver is designated in the escalation hierarchy
Email/notification service is operational
System monitoring service is running and checking for overdue approvals

steps.action: Create a schedule change request and submit it for approval
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request is created successfully and status is set to 'Pending Approval'

steps.action: Wait for the configured threshold period to elapse without approval action (or simulate time passage in test environment)
steps.expectedResult: System detects that the approval is overdue based on the configured threshold. Approval status shows as 'Overdue' or 'Escalated'

steps.action: System automatically triggers escalation process and sends notification to higher-level approver
steps.expectedResult: Escalation notification is sent to the designated higher-level approver via email/system notification containing request details, original approver information, and escalation reason. Notification is received within 5 minutes of threshold breach

steps.action: Higher-level approver logs in and views the escalated request in their approval queue
steps.expectedResult: Escalated request appears in the higher-level approver's queue with 'Escalated' indicator and shows escalation timestamp

steps.action: Escalated approver reviews and approves the schedule change request
steps.expectedResult: Approval status updates to 'Approved'. Original requester receives approval notification. Escalation is marked as resolved in the system

steps.action: Verify escalation history log for the request
steps.expectedResult: Escalation history shows complete audit trail including: original submission time, threshold breach time, escalation trigger time, escalated approver details, and resolution time with timestamps

postconditions: Schedule change request is approved
Escalation is logged in system history
All stakeholders are notified of approval
Escalation metrics are updated in reporting dashboard
Request is removed from pending escalation queue

testCases.title: Manual escalation by approver
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role credentials
Schedule change request is pending approval and assigned to the approver
Approver has permission to perform manual escalations
Higher-level approver is designated in escalation hierarchy
Manual escalation feature is enabled in the system

steps.action: Approver navigates to their pending approvals queue
steps.expectedResult: List of pending schedule change requests is displayed

steps.action: Approver selects a specific pending request that requires urgent attention
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing full information about the schedule change

steps.action: Approver clicks on 'Escalate' button or selects 'Manual Escalation' option from the actions menu
steps.expectedResult: Escalation dialog or form appears prompting for escalation reason and designated approver selection

steps.action: Approver enters escalation reason (e.g., 'Requires senior management review') and confirms the escalation
steps.expectedResult: Manual escalation is processed successfully. Escalation notification is sent to the designated higher-level approver with the reason provided. Confirmation message is displayed to the approver

steps.action: Navigate to escalation history or audit log for the request
steps.expectedResult: Escalation history shows the manual escalation entry with timestamp, escalating approver name, escalated-to approver name, escalation reason, and 'Manual' escalation type indicator

steps.action: Verify the designated higher-level approver receives the escalation notification
steps.expectedResult: Higher-level approver receives notification with request details, manual escalation indicator, and reason provided by the original approver

postconditions: Request is escalated to higher-level approver
Manual escalation is logged with complete details
Original approver is notified of escalation confirmation
Request appears in escalated approver's queue
Escalation metrics are updated

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized manual escalation
preconditions: User is logged in without Approver role or escalation permissions (e.g., Employee, Requester)
Schedule change request exists in the system
Authorization controls are configured for escalation actions
User does not have escalation privileges in their role permissions

steps.action: Unauthorized user attempts to access a schedule change request details page
steps.expectedResult: Request details page loads with limited view permissions (if allowed) or access is denied

steps.action: Unauthorized user attempts to locate and click on 'Escalate' button or manual escalation option
steps.expectedResult: Escalate button is either not visible/hidden for unauthorized users, or is disabled/grayed out

steps.action: If escalation option is visible, unauthorized user attempts to click it or attempts to access escalation API endpoint directly
steps.expectedResult: Access denied error is displayed with message such as 'You do not have permission to escalate approvals' or 'Unauthorized action'. No escalation is processed

steps.action: Verify system security logs for the unauthorized escalation attempt
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized escalation attempt is logged in security audit trail with timestamp, user ID, attempted action, and denial reason

steps.action: Verify that no escalation notification was sent and escalation history remains unchanged
steps.expectedResult: No escalation notifications are sent. Escalation history for the request shows no new entries. Request status remains unchanged

postconditions: No unauthorized escalation occurred
Request status and assignment remain unchanged
Security violation is logged
User remains on current page or is redirected appropriately
System security integrity is maintained

storyTitle: As Manager, I want to receive alerts for failed schedule change approval processes to promptly address issues

testCases.title: Detect and alert on approval workflow failure
preconditions: Manager user account is active and has proper authorization
Manager email address is configured in the system
Alert settings are properly configured for the manager
Schedule change approval workflow is operational
WorkflowLogs database is accessible
Email and in-app notification services are running
Manager has access to the alert history interface

steps.action: Navigate to the test environment and access the workflow simulation tool
steps.expectedResult: Workflow simulation tool loads successfully

steps.action: Simulate a failure in the schedule change approval workflow by triggering a test failure event (e.g., invalid approver, system timeout, or data validation error)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the failure event and logs it in WorkflowLogs with timestamp and failure type

steps.action: Wait for the system to process the failure event and trigger the alert mechanism
steps.expectedResult: Alert is generated and queued for delivery to the designated manager

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox for the alert notification
steps.expectedResult: Manager receives an email alert containing failure details including workflow ID, failure type, timestamp, affected schedule, and recommended actions

steps.action: Log in to the system as the manager and check the in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: Manager sees an in-app notification with the same detailed failure information including workflow ID, failure type, timestamp, affected schedule, and recommended actions

steps.action: As the manager, navigate to the alert history section in the application
steps.expectedResult: Alert history page loads successfully showing all historical alerts

steps.action: Search for the recently triggered alert in the alert history
steps.expectedResult: Alert is logged in the history with correct details including timestamp, recipient name, failure type, workflow ID, delivery status (email and in-app), and alert content

steps.action: Verify the alert details match the simulated failure event
steps.expectedResult: All alert details accurately reflect the simulated failure including correct workflow ID, failure reason, and timestamp

postconditions: Alert is successfully logged in the alert history database
Manager has received both email and in-app notifications
Failure event is properly recorded in WorkflowLogs
Alert delivery status is marked as successful
System is ready to detect and alert on subsequent failures

testCases.title: Verify alert delivery within SLA
preconditions: Manager user account is active with proper authorization
Alert settings are configured for the manager
Email and in-app notification services are operational
System clock is synchronized and accurate
WorkflowLogs database is accessible
Performance monitoring tools are available to track timing
Schedule change approval workflow is operational

steps.action: Prepare timing measurement tools and note the current system time
steps.expectedResult: Timing tools are ready and baseline time is recorded

steps.action: Trigger a failure event in the schedule change approval workflow and record the exact timestamp of the failure
steps.expectedResult: Failure event is triggered and timestamp is captured (T0)

steps.action: Monitor the system logs and alert queue for alert generation
steps.expectedResult: System detects the failure and generates an alert entry in the queue

steps.action: Check the manager's email inbox and record the timestamp when the email alert is received
steps.expectedResult: Email alert is received and timestamp is recorded (T1)

steps.action: Log in as the manager and check the in-app notification center, recording the timestamp when the notification appears
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is displayed and timestamp is recorded (T2)

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between failure trigger (T0) and email delivery (T1)
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than or equal to 2 minutes (120 seconds)

steps.action: Calculate the time difference between failure trigger (T0) and in-app notification delivery (T2)
steps.expectedResult: Time difference is less than or equal to 2 minutes (120 seconds)

steps.action: Review the alert history log to verify the recorded delivery timestamps
steps.expectedResult: Alert history shows delivery timestamps that confirm SLA compliance (within 2 minutes of failure detection)

postconditions: Alert delivery time is documented and meets SLA requirements
Performance metrics are recorded for reporting
Alert is logged with accurate delivery timestamps
System demonstrates compliance with 2-minute SLA requirement

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized access to alert management
preconditions: Unauthorized user account exists in the system (non-manager role)
Unauthorized user has valid login credentials
Alert configuration interface is deployed and accessible
Security and access control mechanisms are active
Manager role permissions are properly configured in the system
Alert management features are protected by role-based access control

steps.action: Log in to the system using unauthorized user credentials (user without manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs in to the system with limited permissions

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the alert configuration page by entering the URL directly or through navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied and an error message is displayed stating 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to access alert configuration' or similar authorization error

steps.action: Attempt to access the alert configuration API endpoint directly using POST /api/alerts with unauthorized credentials
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Attempt to view the alert history page as an unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message indicating the feature is restricted to authorized managers only

steps.action: Attempt to modify alert settings by manipulating request parameters or using browser developer tools
steps.expectedResult: All modification attempts are blocked and security logs record the unauthorized access attempt

steps.action: Verify that no alert configuration data or sensitive information is exposed in the error response
steps.expectedResult: Error messages do not reveal system architecture, database structure, or sensitive configuration details

steps.action: Check security audit logs for the unauthorized access attempts
steps.expectedResult: All unauthorized access attempts are logged with user ID, timestamp, attempted action, and denial reason

postconditions: Unauthorized user remains unable to access alert management features
No unauthorized changes were made to alert configurations
Security audit logs contain records of all access attempts
System security integrity is maintained
Alert configuration remains protected and unchanged
